skill.name: Testing Test Writing
skill.description: Write focused tests for core user flows and critical paths using Pest framework, with minimal tests during development and strategic coverage at completion points. Use this skill when creating or editing test files in tests/Feature/ or tests/Unit/ directories, when writing Pest tests with descriptive names, when testing critical user workflows and business logic, when mocking external dependencies, when implementing fast unit tests, when testing behavior rather than implementation details, or when deciding what needs test coverage at feature completion.

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only documentation and testing guidelines. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own content. Purely informational skill for writing Pest tests.

content.user_title: Write Pest Tests for Critical User Flows
content.value_statement: Writing comprehensive tests for Laravel applications can be time-consuming and unclear. This skill provides focused guidance on writing meaningful tests that cover core user workflows using the Pest framework, ensuring quality without over-testing.
actual_capabilities: Creates test files in tests/Feature/ and tests/Unit/ directories
Writes descriptive Pest test names for clear documentation
Tests core user workflows and critical business logic paths
Mocks external dependencies like databases, APIs, and file systems
Uses Pest datasets for handling multiple test scenarios efficiently
Focuses tests on behavior and outcomes rather than implementation details
limitations: Does not execute tests or provide test run results
Does not configure testing environments or CI/CD pipelines
Does not generate test coverage reports or metrics
Limited to Pest framework conventions for Laravel applications

use_cases.title: Set Up Test Coverage Strategy
use_cases.description: Determine which features need tests and prioritize critical user paths before starting development

use_cases.title: Write Integration Tests
use_cases.description: Create tests that verify API endpoints, validation rules, and business logic work correctly together

use_cases.title: Practice Test Driven Development
use_cases.description: Write tests first for new features, focusing on behavior rather than implementation details

prompt_templates.title: Create Unit Test
prompt_templates.scenario: Write unit test for a model method
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Pest unit test for the User model's isActive method. Include test cases for active and inactive users using a dataset.

prompt_templates.title: Test API Endpoint
prompt_templates.scenario: Create feature test for API route
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Pest feature test for the POST /api/users endpoint. Test validation rules, successful creation, and error responses.

prompt_templates.title: Mock External Service
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a test that mocks an external payment API. Verify the success and failure paths without making real network calls.

prompt_templates.title: Test Critical Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a feature test for the complete user registration and email verification workflow. Test the critical path and error handling.

output_examples.input: Write a test for the user registration form validation
output: Added tests for required fields, email format, password strength
Included dataset with valid and invalid test cases
Mocked the email service to verify notification dispatch

best_practices: Focus on testing behavior and outcomes rather than internal implementation details
Use descriptive test names that document what the test is verifying
Leverage Pest datasets to efficiently test multiple scenarios with shared setup
Mock external dependencies to keep tests fast and isolated
anti_patterns: Avoid testing implementation details that may change without affecting behavior
Do not write tests for every single method without considering their importance
Avoid coupling tests too tightly to specific framework internals
Do not skip testing edge cases that could cause production issues

faq.question: What testing frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on the Pest framework, which is the recommended testing framework for Laravel applications.

faq.question: How is test coverage determined?
faq.answer: The skill emphasizes testing critical user flows and business logic rather than pursuing 100% coverage.

faq.question: Can this skill run tests for me?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance on writing tests. Use php artisan test to execute tests.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only provides guidance and does not access any files or data on your system.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on Pest conventions and strategic test coverage for Laravel applications.

faq.question: Does this skill work with PHPUnit?
faq.answer: The guidance is Pest-specific. PHPUnit users should refer to Laravel's standard testing documentation.
